description: This file declares the RequestHandler class within the WPEFramework::Plugin namespace. The class provides methods for lifecycle management, including initialization, termination, launching, terminating, updating state, and sending intents, as well as accessors for related component handlers. It also includes design patterns such as singleton implementation.
published: bool launch(ApplicationContext* context, const string& launchIntent, const Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
bool terminate(ApplicationContext* context, bool force, string& errorReason)
bool sendIntent(ApplicationContext* context, const string& intent, string& errorReason)
bool updateState(ApplicationContext* context, Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: A singleton class responsible for managing lifecycle requests within the plugin, holding references to runtime and window manager handlers, and an event handler.

methods.name: RequestHandler(const RequestHandler& obj) = delete
methods.description: Deleted copy constructor to prevent copying of singleton instance.

methods.name: static RequestHandler* getInstance()
methods.description: Provides access to the singleton instance of RequestHandler.

methods.name: bool initialize(PluginHost::IShell* service, IEventHandler* eventHandler)
methods.description: Initializes the request handler with service and event handler.

methods.name: void terminate()
methods.description: Terminates the request handler, cleaning up resources.

methods.name: bool launch(ApplicationContext* context, const string& launchIntent, const Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Launches an application with the given intent and target state.

methods.name: bool terminate(ApplicationContext* context, bool force, string& errorReason)
bool sendIntent(ApplicationContext* context, const string& intent, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Sends an intent to the application.

methods.name: bool updateState(ApplicationContext* context, Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Updates the lifecycle state of an application.
